Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk systemtap
exit 0

isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk systemtap-client
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: systemtap bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: SystemTap is an instrumentation system for systems running the Linux kernel, which allows developers to write scripts to collect data on the operation of the system. The systemtap packages have been upgraded to upstream version 2.8, which provides a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the previous version. Among others: Documentation has been improved, including manual pages and cross references. Diagnostics have been improved. The output is now colorized. Namespace-aware identifier lookup functions have been added to the tapset library. Golang support has been improved. String passing has been optimized. Functions in the tapset library now support address-to-file:line mapping. System-call probes in the tapset have been improved, especially the non-DWARF nd_syscall variants. Improved compatibility on the little-endian variant of IBM Power Systems architecture and on the ARM 64-bit architecture. (BZ#1197246) This update also fixes the following bugs: Previous kernel changes to the module-load notifier facility caused that SystemTap did not receive timely notifications. Consequently, SystemTap was unable to place probes on module-initializer functions. With this update, SystemTap has been fixed to use also kernel tracepoints to supplement the module-load notifier. As a result, SystemTap now receives timely notifications, thus enabling module-initializer probing. (BZ#1257399) A previous kernel change related to ABI symbol-versioning caused that SystemTap could not create kernel-compatible netfilter function declarations. As a consequence, SystemTap was unable to compile netfilter probes. With this update, SystemTap has been adjusted to kernel's ABI symbol-versioning pattern, and netfilter probes now work as expected. (BZ#1248159) Prior to this update, SystemTap made an XFS-incompatible check in its module-signing key-search functionality. Consequently, SecureBoot module signing on XFS file systems failed. This bug has been fixed, an XFS-compatible directory check is now performed, and SecureBoot module signing works on XFS file systems as expected. (BZ#1212658) Previous kernel changes in the NFS subsystem renamed variables and added functions. As a consequence, probes using the SystemTap NFS tapset library failed to compile. This bug has been fixed, and probes using the SystemTap NFS tapset library compile correctly. (BZ#1214176) Users of systemtap are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
